title: List of Australia Twenty20 International cricket records
text:
A Twenty20 International (T20I) is a form of <a href="cricket">cricket</a>, played between two of the international members of the <a href="International%20Cricket%20Council">International Cricket Council</a> (ICC), in which each team faces a maximum of twenty <a href="Over%20%28cricket%29">overs</a>. The matches have top-class status and are the highest T20 standard. The game is played under the rules of <a href="Twenty20">Twenty20</a> cricket. The first Twenty20 International match between two men's sides was played on 17 February 2005, involving <a href="Australia%20national%20cricket%20team">Australia</a> and <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20cricket%20team">New Zealand</a>. "<a href="Wisden%20Cricketers%27%20Almanack">Wisden Cricketers' Almanack</a>" reported that "neither side took the game especially seriously", and it was noted by "<a href="ESPNcricinfo">ESPNcricinfo</a>" that but for a large score for <a href="Ricky%20Ponting">Ricky Ponting</a>, "the concept would have shuddered". However, Ponting himself said "if it does become an international game then I'm sure the novelty won't be there all the time".
This is a list of <a href="Australia%20national%20cricket%20team">Australia Cricket team</a>'s <a href="Twenty20%20International">Twenty20 International</a> records. It is based on the <a href="List%20of%20Twenty20%20International%20records">List of Twenty20 International records</a>, but concentrates solely on records dealing with the Australian cricket team. Australia played the first ever T20I in 2005.
Key.
The top five records are listed for each category, except for the <a href="%23Team%20wins%2C%20losses%2C%20draws%20and%20ties">team wins, losses, draws and ties</a>, <a href="%23All-round%20Records">all round records</a> and the <a href="%23Partnership%20records">partnership records</a>. Tied records for fifth place are also included. Explanations of the general symbols and cricketing terms used in the list are given below. Specific details are provided in each category where appropriate. All records include matches played for <a href="Australia%20national%20cricket%20team">Australia</a> only, and are correct .
Team records.
Team wins, losses, draws and ties.
, Australia has played 152 T20I matches <a href="result%20%28cricket%29">resulting</a> in 78 victories, 69 defeats, 2 ties and 3 no results for an overall winning percentage of 53.02.
Team scoring records.
Most runs in an innings.
The highest innings total scored in T20Is has been scored twice. The first occasion came in the match between <a href="Afghanistan%20national%20cricket%20team">Afghanistan</a> and <a href="Ireland%20national%20cricket%20team">Ireland</a> when Afghanistan scored 278/3 in the 2nd T20I of the <a href="Irish%20cricket%20team%20against%20Afghanistan%20in%20India%20in%202018-19">Ireland series in India in February 2019</a>. The <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20cricket%20team">Czech Republic national cricket team</a> against <a href="Turkey%20national%20cricket%20team">Turkey</a> during the <a href="2019%20Continental%20Cup%20%28cricket%29">2019 Continental Cup</a> scored 278/4 to equal the record. The highest score for Australia is 263/3 scored against Sri Lanka during the <a href="Australian%20cricket%20team%20in%20Sri%20Lanka%20in%202016">2016 tour of Sri Lanka</a>.
Fewest runs in an innings.
The lowest innings total scored was by <a href="Turkey%20national%20cricket%20team">Turkey</a> against <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20cricket%20team">Czech Republic</a> when they were dismissed for 21 during the <a href="2019%20Continental%20Cup%20%28cricket%29">2019 Continental Cup</a>. The lowest score in T20I history for Australia is 62 scored against Bangladesh in the <a href="Australian%20cricket%20team%20in%20Bangladesh%20in%202021">2021 tour of Bangladesh</a>.
Most runs conceded an innings.
The fifth match of the <a href="2017-18%20Trans-Tasman%20Tri-Series">2017-18 Trans-Tasman Tri-Series</a> against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20cricket%20team">New Zealand</a> saw Australia concede their highest innings total of 243/6.
Fewest runs conceded in an innings.
The lowest score conceded by Australia for a full inning is 73 when they dismissed IBangladeshduring the <a href="2021%20ICC%20Men%27s%20T20%20World%20Cup">2021 ICC Men's T20 World Cup</a> at Dubai Sports City.
Most runs aggregate in a match.
The highest match aggregate scored in T20Is came in the match between <a href="India%20national%20cricket%20team">India</a> and <a href="West%20Indies%20national%20cricket%20team">West Indies</a> in the first T20I of the <a href="Indian%20cricket%20team%20in%20the%20West%20Indies%20in%202016">August 2016 series</a> at <a href="Central%20Broward%20Regional%20Park">Central Broward Regional Park</a>, <a href="Lauderhill">Lauderhill</a> when India scored 244/4 in response to West Indies score of 245/6 to lose the match by 1 run. The fifth match of the <a href="2017-18%20Trans-Tasman%20Tri-Series">2017-18 Trans-Tasman Tri-Series</a> against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20cricket%20team">New Zealand</a> saw ä total of 488 runs being scored, the most involving Australia.
Fewest runs aggregate in a match.
The lowest match aggregate in T20Is is 57 when <a href="Turkey%20national%20cricket%20team">Turkey</a> were dismissed for 28 by <a href="Luxembourg%20national%20cricket%20team">Luxembourg</a> in the second T20I of the <a href="2019%20Continental%20Cup%20%28cricket%29">2019 Continental Cup in Romania in August 2019</a>. The lowest match aggregate in T20I history for Australia is 149 scored during the only T20I of <a href="Indian%20cricket%20team%20in%20Australia%20in%202007-08">India's tour of Australia in February 2008</a>.
Result records.
A T20I match is <a href="result%20%28cricket%29">won</a> when one side has scored more <a href="run%20%28cricket%29">runs</a> than the runs scored by the opposing side during their <a href="innings">innings</a>. If both sides have completed both their allocated innings and the side that fielded last has the higher aggregate of runs, it is known as a win by runs. This indicates the number of runs that they had scored more than the opposing side. If the side batting last wins the match, it is known as a win by <a href="Wicket%23Dismissing%20a%20batsman">wickets</a>, indicating the number of wickets that were still to fall.
Greatest win margins (by runs).
The greatest winning margin by runs in T20Is was Czech Republic's victory over Turkey by 257 runs in the sixth match of the <a href="2019%20Continental%20Cup%20%28cricket%29">2019 Continental Cup</a>. The largest victory recorded by Australia was during the <a href="Australian%20cricket%20team%20in%20Sri%20Lanka%20in%202016">Australia's tour of Sri Lanka in 2016</a> by 134 runs.
Greatest win margins (by balls remaining).
The greatest winning margin by balls remaining in T20Is was Austria's victory over Turkey by 104 balls remaining in the ninth match of the <a href="2019%20Continental%20Cup%20%28cricket%29">2019 Continental Cup</a>. The largest victory recorded by Australia is during the <a href="2007%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2007 ICC World Twenty20</a> against Sri Lanka when they won by 10 wickets with 58 balls remaining.
Greatest win margins (by wickets).
A total of 22 matches have ended with chasing team winning by 10 wickets with New Zealand winning by such margins a record three times. Australia have won a T20I match by this margin on two occasions.
Highest successful run chases.
Australia holds the record for the highest successful run chase which they achieved when they scored 245/5 in response to New Zealand's 243/6.
Narrowest win margins (by runs).
The narrowest run margin victory is by 1 run which has been achieved in 15 T20I's with Australia winning such games once.
Narrowest win margins (by balls remaining).
The narrowest winning margin by balls remaining in T20Is is by winning of the last ball which has been achieved 26 times. Australia has achieve victory of the last ball on two occasions.
Narrowest win margins (by wickets).
The narrowest margin of victory by wickets is 1 wicket which has settled four such T20Is. The narrowest victory by wickets for Australia is two wickets.
Greatest loss margins (by runs).
Australia's biggest defeat by runs was against England in the <a href="Australian%20cricket%20team%20in%20England%20in%202005">2005 only T20I</a> at <a href="Rose%20Bowl%20%28cricket%20ground%29">Rose Bowl</a>, <a href="Southampton">Southampton</a>, England.
Greatest loss margins (by balls remaining).
The largest defeat suffered by Australia was against <a href="England%20national%20cricket%20team">England</a> in UAE during the <a href="2021%20ICC%20Men%27s%20T20%20World%20Cup">2021 ICC Men's T20 World Cup</a> when they lost by 8 wickets with 50 balls remaining.
Greatest loss margins (by wickets).
Australia have lost a T20I match by a margin of 9 wickets on one occasion.
Narrowest loss margins (by runs).
The narrowest loss of Australia in terms of runs is by 2 runs suffered twice.
Narrowest loss margins (by balls remaining).
Australia has suffered loss off the last ball four times.
Narrowest loss margins (by wickets).
Australia has suffered defeat by 1 wicket once.
Tied matches.
A <a href="Result%20%28cricket%29%23Tie">tie</a> can occur when the scores of both teams are equal at the conclusion of play, provided that the side batting last has completed their innings. 
There have been 19 <a href="List%20of%20tied%20Twenty20%20Internationals">ties</a> in T20Is history with Australia involved in two such game.
Individual records.
Batting records.
Most career runs.
A <a href="run%20%28cricket%29">run</a> is the basic means of <a href="scoring%20%28cricket%29">scoring</a> in cricket. A run is scored when the batsman hits the <a href="cricket%20ball">ball</a> with his <a href="cricket%20bat">bat</a> and with his partner runs the length of of the <a href="cricket%20pitch">pitch</a>.
India's <a href="Virat%20Kohli">Virat Kohli</a> has scored the most runs in T20Is with 3,227. Second is <a href="Martin%20Guptill">Martin Guptill</a> from New Zealand with 3,119 ahead of <a href="Rohit%20Sharma">Rohit Sharma</a> of India in third with 3,038. <a href="Aaron%20Finch">Aaron Finch</a> is the leading Australian batsmen on this list.
Highest individual score.
The third T20I of the <a href="2018%20Zimbabwe%20Tri-Nation%20Series">2018 Zimbabwe Tri-Nation Series</a> saw <a href="Aaron%20Finch">Aaron Finch</a> score the highest Individual score.
Highest career average.
A batsman's <a href="batting%20average%20%28cricket%29">batting average</a> is the total number of runs they have scored divided by the number of times they have been dismissed.
Most half-centuries.
A half-century is a score of between 50 and 99 runs. Statistically, once a batsman's score reaches 100, it is no longer considered a half-century but a century.
<a href="Virat%20Kohli">Virat Kohli</a> of India has scored most half-centuries in T20Is i.e 28 fifties. <a href="David%20Warner%20%28cricketer%29">David Warner</a> has scored most 50s for Aussies.
Most centuries.
A <a href="century%20%28cricket%29">century</a> is a score of 100 or more runs in a single inning.
Rohit Sharma has scored the most centuries in T20Is with 4. Glenn Maxwell, with three such knocks, holds the Australian record.
Highest strike rates.
<a href="Ramesh%20Satheesan">Ramesh Satheesan</a> of Romania holds the record for highest strike rate, with minimum 250 balls faced qualification, with 188.35. Maxwell is the Australian with the highest strike rate.
Highest strike rates in an inning.
<a href="Dwayne%20Smith">Dwayne Smith</a> of West Indies strike rate of 414.28 during his 29 off 7 balls against <a href="Bangladesh%20national%20cricket%20team">Bangladesh</a> during <a href="2007%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2007 ICC World Twenty20</a> is the world record for highest strike rate in an innings. <a href="Aaron%20Finch">Aaron Finch</a> with his innings of 36* off 14 balls against New Zealand in February 2018 during the <a href="2017-18%20Trans-Tasman%20Tri-Series">2017-18 Trans-Tasman Tri-Series</a> holds the top position for an Australia player in this list.
Most runs in a calendar year.
Mohammad Rizwan of Pakistan holds the record for most runs scored in a calendar year with 1033 runs scored in 2021. Mitchell Marsh scored 550 runs in 2021, the most for an Australian batsmen in a year.
Most runs in a series.
The <a href="2014%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2014 ICC World Twenty20</a> in Bangladesh saw <a href="Virat%20Kohli">Virat Kohli</a> set the record for the most runs scored in a single series scoring 319 runs. He is followed by <a href="Tillakaratne%20Dilshan">Tillakaratne Dilshan</a> with 317 runs scored in the <a href="2009%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2009 ICC World Twenty20</a>. <a href="Aaron%20Finch">Aaron Finch</a> has scored the most runs in a series for an Australia batsmen, when he scored 306 runs in the <a href="2018%20Zimbabwe%20Tri-Nation%20Series">2018 Zimbabwe Tri-Nation Series</a>.
Most ducks.
A <a href="duck%20%28cricket%29">duck</a> refers to a batsman being dismissed without scoring a run. 
Ireland's <a href="Kevin%20O%27Brien%20%28cricketer%29">Kevin O'Brien</a> has the most number of ducks in T20Is with 12 such knocks followed by <a href="Tillakaratne%20Dilshan">Tillakaratne Dilshan</a> of Sri Lanka, <a href="Soumya%20Sarkar">Soumya Sarkar</a> of Bangladesh and Pakistan's <a href="Umar%20Akmal">Umar Akmal</a> with 10 such knocks. Aaron Finch with 7 ducks has the highest number of such knocks for Australia.
Bowling records.
Most career wickets.
A <a href="bowling%20%28cricket%29">bowler</a> takes the <a href="wicket%23dismissing%20a%20batsman">wicket</a> of a batsman when the form of dismissal is <a href="bowled">bowled</a>, <a href="caught">caught</a>, <a href="leg%20before%20wicket">leg before wicket</a>, <a href="stumped">stumped</a> or <a href="hit%20wicket">hit wicket</a>. If the batsman is dismissed by <a href="run%20out">run out</a>, <a href="obstructing%20the%20field">obstructing the field</a>, <a href="handled%20the%20ball">handling the ball</a>, <a href="hit%20the%20ball%20twice">hitting the ball twice</a> or <a href="timed%20out">timed out</a> the bowler does not receive credit.
Bangladesh's <a href="Shakib%20Al%20Hasan">Shakib Al Hasan</a> is the highest wicket-taker in T20Is. <a href="Adam%20Zampa">Adam Zampa</a> is the highest ranked Aussie bowler on the all-time.
Best figures in an innings.
<a href="Bowling%20analysis">Bowling figures</a> refers to the number of the wickets a bowler has taken and the number of runs conceded.
India's <a href="Deepak%20Chahar">Deepak Chahar</a> holds the world record for best figures in an innings when he took 6/7 against Bangladesh in <a href="Bangladeshi%20cricket%20team%20in%20India%20in%202019-20">November 2019</a> at <a href="Vidarbha%20Cricket%20Association%20Stadium">Nagpur</a>. <a href="Ashton%20Agar">Ashton Agar</a> holds the Australian record for best bowling figures.
Best career average.
A bowler's <a href="bowling%20average">bowling average</a> is the total number of runs they have conceded divided by the number of wickets they have taken.
<a href="Afghanistan%20national%20cricket%20team">Afghanistan</a>'s <a href="Rashid%20Khan%20%28cricketer%29">Rashid Khan</a> holds the record for the best career average in T20Is with 12.62. <a href="Ajantha%20Mendis">Ajantha Mendis</a>, Sri Lankan <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er, is second behind Rashid with an overall career average of 14.42 runs per wicket. <a href="Mitchell%20Starc">Mitchell Starc</a> with an average of 18.65 is the highest ranked Aussie bowler.
Best career economy rate.
A bowler's <a href="economy%20rate%20%28cricket%29">economy rate</a> is the total number of runs they have conceded divided by the number of <a href="over%20%28cricket%29">overs</a> they have bowled.
New Zealand's <a href="Daniel%20Vettori">Daniel Vettori</a>, holds the T20I record for the best career economy rate with 5.70. <a href="Adam%20Zampa">Adam Zampa</a>, with a rate of 6.51 runs per over conceded over his 37-match T20I career, is the highest Australian on the list.
Best career strike rate.
A bowler's <a href="strike%20rate">strike rate</a> is the total number of <a href="delivery%20%28cricket%29">balls</a> they have bowled divided by the number of wickets they have taken.
The top bowler with the best T20I career strike rate is Rashid Khan of Afghanistan with strike rate of 12.3 balls per wicket. <a href="James%20Faulkner%20%28cricketer%29">James Faulkner</a> is the Aussie bowler with the lowest strike rate.
Most four-wickets (& over) hauls in an innings.
Pakistan's <a href="Umar%20Gul">Umar Gul</a> has taken the most four-wickets (or over) among all the bowlers. 11 Aussies bowlers have taken at-least one such haul.
Best economy rates in an inning.
The best economy rate in an inning, when a minimum of 12 balls are delivered by the bowler, is Sri Lankan player <a href="Nuwan%20Kulasekara">Nuwan Kulasekara</a> economy of 0.00 during his spell of 0 runs for 1 wicket in 2 overs against Netherlands at <a href="Zohur%20Ahmed%20Chowdhury%20Stadium">Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium</a> in the <a href="2014%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2014 ICC World Twenty20</a>. <a href="David%20Hussey">David Hussey</a> holds the Australian record during his spell in <a href="Indian%20cricket%20team%20in%20Australia%20in%202011-12">India's tour of Australia in 2012</a> at Sydney, Australia and by <a href="Billy%20Stanlake">Billy Stanlake</a> against Pakistan during the <a href="2018%20Zimbabwe%20Tri-Nation%20Series">2018 Zimbabwe Tri-Nation Series</a>.
Best strike rates in an inning.
The best strike rate in an inning, when a minimum of 4 wickets are taken by the player, is by <a href="Steve%20Tikolo">Steve Tikolo</a> of Kenya during his spell of 4/2 in 1.2 overs against Scotland during the <a href="2013%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20%20Qualifier">2013 ICC World Twenty20 Qualifier</a> at <a href="ICC%20Academy">ICC Academy</a>, <a href="Dubai">Dubai</a>, UAE. Both Faulkner and Agar during their spells when they took five-wickets in an inning also recorded the best strike rate for an Aussie bowler.
Worst figures in an innings.
The worst figures in a T20I came in the <a href="Sri%20Lankan%20cricket%20team%20in%20Australia%20in%202019-20">Sri Lanka's tour of Australia</a> when <a href="Kasun%20Rajitha">Kasun Rajitha</a> of Sri Lanka had figures of 0/75 off his four overs at <a href="Adelaide%20Oval">Adelaide Oval</a>, <a href="Adelaide">Adelaide</a>. The worst figures by an Australian is 0/59 that came off the bowling of <a href="Kane%20Richardson">Kane Richardson</a> in the <a href="Australian%20cricket%20team%20in%20England%20in%202018">2018 tour of England</a> at <a href="Edgbaston%20Cricket%20Ground">Edgbaston Cricket Ground</a>, <a href="Birmingham">Birmingham</a>, England.
Most runs conceded in a match.
Kasun Rajitha also holds the dubious distinction of most runs conceded in a T20I during the aforementioned match. <a href="Andrew%20Tye">Andrew Tye</a> with figures of 2/64 off his four overs against New Zealand in February 2018 holds the most runs conceded distinction for Australia.
Most wickets in a calendar year.
Australia's <a href="Andrew%20Tye">Andrew Tye</a> holds the record for most wickets taken in a year when he took 31 wickets in 2018 in 19 T20Is.
Most wickets in a series.
<a href="2019%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20%20Qualifier">2019 ICC World Twenty20 Qualifier</a> at UAE saw records set for the most wickets taken by a bowler in a T20I series when Oman's <a href="pace%20bowling">pacer</a> <a href="Bilal%20Khan%20%28cricketer%29">Bilal Khan</a> tool 18 wickets during the series. <a href="Dirk%20Nannes">Dirk Nannes</a> in the <a href="2010%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2010 ICC World Twenty20</a> took 14 wickets, the most for an Aussie bowler in a series.
Hat-trick.
In <a href="cricket">cricket</a>, a hat-trick occurs when a bowler <a href="Dismissal%20%28cricket%29">takes three wickets</a> with consecutive <a href="Delivery%20%28cricket%29">deliveries</a>. The deliveries may be interrupted by an <a href="over%20%28cricket%29">over</a> bowled by another bowler from the other end of the <a href="Cricket%20pitch">pitch</a> or the other team's <a href="innings">innings</a>, but must be three consecutive deliveries by the individual bowler in the same match. Only <a href="wickets%23Dismissing%20a%20batsman">wickets</a> attributed to the bowler count towards a hat-trick; run outs do not count.
In <a href="Twenty20%20International">T20Is</a> history there have been just <a href="List%20of%20Twenty20%20International%20cricket%20hat-tricks">13 hat-tricks</a>, the first achieved by <a href="Brett%20Lee">Brett Lee</a> for <a href="Australia%20national%20cricket%20team">Australia</a> against <a href="Bangladesh%20cricket%20team">Bangladesh</a> in <a href="2007%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2007 ICC World Twenty20</a>.
Wicket-keeping records.
The <a href="wicket-keeper">wicket-keeper</a> is a specialist <a href="fielding%20%28cricket%29">fielder</a> who stands behind the <a href="stump%20%28cricket%29">stumps</a> being guarded by the batsman on <a href="strike%20%28cricket%29">strike</a> and is the only member of the fielding side allowed to wear gloves and leg pads.
Most career dismissals.
A wicket-keeper can be credited with the dismissal of a batsman in two ways, <a href="caught">caught</a> or <a href="stumped">stumped</a>. A fair catch is taken when the <a href="cricket%20ball">ball</a> is caught fully within the field of play without it bouncing after the ball has touched the striker's <a href="cricket%20bat">bat</a> or glove holding the bat, Laws 5.6.2.2 and 5.6.2.3 state that the hand or the glove holding the bat shall be regarded as the ball striking or touching the bat while a stumping occurs when the wicket-keeper puts down the wicket while the batsman is out of his <a href="crease%20%28cricket%29">ground</a> and not attempting a run.
<a href="Brad%20Haddin">Brad Haddin</a> and <a href="Alex%20Carey%20%28cricketer%29">Alex Carey</a> is the highest ranked Aussie wicket keeper in the all-time list of taking most dismissals in T20Is as a designated wicket-keeper, which is headed by India's <a href="MS%20Dhoni">MS Dhoni</a> and West Indian <a href="Denesh%20Ramdin">Denesh Ramdin</a>.
Most career catches.
Haddin and <a href="Adam%20Gilchrist">Adam Gilchrist</a> have taken the most catches in T20Is as a designated wicket-keeper with Dhoni and Ramdin leading the all-time list.
Most career stumpings.
Carey has made the most stumpings in T20Is as a designated wicket-keeper among Aussies with Dhoni and <a href="Kamran%20Akmal">Kamran Akmal</a> of Pakistan heading this all-time list.
Most dismissals in an innings.
Four wicket-keepers on four occasions have taken five dismissals in a single innings in a T20I.
The feat of taking 4 dismissals in an innings has been achieved by 19 wicket-keepers on 26 occasions with Gilchrist being the only Australian wicket-keeper.
Most dismissals in a series.
Netherlands wicket-keeper <a href="Scott%20Edwards%20%28cricketer%29">Scott Edwards</a> holds the T20Is record for the most dismissals taken by a wicket-keeper in a series. He made 13 dismissals during the <a href="2019%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20%20Qualifier">2019 ICC World Twenty20 Qualifier</a>. Australian record is held by Gilchrist when he made 9 dimissials during the <a href="2007%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2007 ICC World Twenty20</a>.
Fielding records.
Most career catches.
<a href="Caught">Caught</a> is one of the nine methods a batsman can be <a href="dismissal%20%28cricket%29">dismissed</a> in cricket. The majority of catches are caught in the <a href="slip%20%28cricket%29">slips</a>, located behind the batsman, next to the wicket-keeper, on the <a href="off%20side">off side</a> of the field. Most slip fielders are <a href="Batting%20order%20%28cricket%29">top order</a> batsmen.
South Africa's <a href="David%20Miller%20%28South%20African%20cricketer%29">David Miller</a> holds the record for the most catches in T20Is by a non-wicket-keeper with 69, followed by New Zealand's <a href="Martin%20Guptill">Martin Guptill</a> on 62 and <a href="Shoaib%20Malik">Shoaib Malik</a> of Pakistan with 50. David Warner is the leading catcher for Australia.
Most catches in an innings.
The feat of taking 4 catches in an innings has been achieved by 14 fielders on 14 occasions. No Australian fielder has achieved this feat. The most is three catches on nine occasions.
Most catches in a series.
The <a href="2019%20ICC%20Men%27s%20T20%20World%20Cup%20Qualifier">2019 ICC Men's T20 World Cup Qualifier</a>, which saw Netherlands retain their title, saw the record set for the most catches taken by a non-wicket-keeper in a T20I series. <a href="Jersey%20national%20cricket%20team">Jersey's</a> <a href="Ben%20Stevens%20%28cricketer%29">Ben Stevens</a> and <a href="Namibia%20national%20cricket%20team">Namibia's</a> <a href="JJ%20Smit">JJ Smit</a> took 10 catches in the series. David Warner and Michael Hussey with 8 catches in the <a href="2010%20ICC%20World%20Twenty20">2010 ICC World Twenty20</a> are the leading Aussie fielder on this list.
Other records.
Most career matches.
Pakistan's <a href="Shoaib%20Malik">Shoaib Malik</a> holds the record for the most T20I matches played with 122, followed by his team mate <a href="Mohammad%20Hafeez">Mohammad Hafeez</a> with 119 and <a href="Rohit%20Sharma">Rohit Sharma</a> of India with 116 games. David Warner is the most experienced Aussie player having represented the team on 87 occasions.
Most consecutive career matches.
Scotland's <a href="Richie%20Berrington">Richie Berrington</a> hold the record for the most consecutive T20I matches played with 70. David Warner holds the Aussie record.
Most matches as captain.
<a href="MS%20Dhoni">MS Dhoni</a>, who led the Indian cricket team from 2007 to 2016, holds the record for the most matches played as captain in T20Is with 72. Aaron Finch has led Australia in most matches for any player from his country.
Youngest players on Debut.
The youngest player to play in a T20I match is Marian Gherasim at the age of 14 years and 16 days. Making his debut for <a href="Romania%20national%20cricket%20team">Romania</a> against the <a href="Bulgaria%20national%20cricket%20team">Bulgaria</a> on 16 October 2020 in the <a href="2020%20T20I%20Balkan%20Cup">first T20I of the 2020 Balkan Cup</a> thus becoming the <a href="List%20of%20Twenty20%20International%20records%23Youngest%20players">youngest to play in a men's T20I match</a>.
Oldest Players on Debut.
The Turkish batsmen Osman Göker is the oldest player to make their debut a T20I match. Playing in the <a href="2019%20Continental%20Cup%20%28cricket%29">2019 Continental Cup</a> against Romania at <a href="Moara%20Vlasiei%20Cricket%20Ground">Moara Vlasiei Cricket Ground</a>, <a href="Moara%20Vl%C4%83siei">Moara Vlăsiei</a> he was aged 59 years and 181 days.
Oldest Players.
The Turkish batsmen Osman Göker is the oldest player to appear in a T20I match during the same above mentioned match.
Partnership records.
In cricket, two batsmen are always present at the <a href="Crease%20%28cricket%29">crease</a> batting together in a partnership. This partnership will continue until one of them is <a href="Dismissal%20%28cricket%29">dismissed</a>, <a href="Substitute%20%28cricket%29%23Retired%20hurt%20%28or%20not%20out%29">retires</a> or the innings comes to a close.
Highest partnerships by wicket.
A wicket partnership describes the number of runs scored before each wicket falls. The first wicket partnership is between the opening batsmen and continues until the first wicket falls. The second wicket partnership then commences between the <a href="not%20out">not out</a> batsman and the number three batsman. This partnership continues until the second wicket falls. The third wicket partnership then commences between the not out batsman and the new batsman. This continues down to the tenth wicket partnership. When the tenth wicket has fallen, there is no batsman left to partner so the innings is closed.
Highest partnerships by runs.
The highest T20I partnership by runs for any wicket is held by the Afghan pairing of <a href="Hazratullah%20Zazai">Hazratullah Zazai</a> and <a href="Usman%20Ghani">Usman Ghani</a> who put together an opening wicket partnership of 236 runs during the <a href="Irish%20cricket%20team%20against%20Afghanistan%20in%20India%20in%202018-19">Ireland v Afghanistan series in India in 2019</a>
Umpiring records.
Most matches umpired.
An <a href="umpire%20%28cricket%29">umpire</a> in cricket is a person who officiates the match according to the "<a href="Laws%20of%20Cricket">Laws of Cricket</a>". Two umpires adjudicate the match on the field, whilst a <a href="third%20umpire">third umpire</a> has access to video replays, and a <a href="fourth%20umpire">fourth umpire</a> looks after the match balls and other duties. The records below are only for on-field umpires.
<a href="Ahsan%20Raza">Ahsan Raza</a> of Pakistan holds the record for the most T20I matches umpired with 49. The most experienced Australian umpire is <a href="Rod%20Tucker">Rod Tucker</a> with 35 matches officiated so far.
